auditorium

Class Generator

  • java.lang.Object
    • auditorium.Generator

  • public class Generator
extends java.lang.Object
    Use an instance of this class to generate RSA keys. It's main method will generate a set of keys, all signed by the same CA key (which it will also generate).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Generator.Keys
      A public/private key pair.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        args - [0] is the number of keys you'd like to generate. [1] is where you want to throw them.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

         java.lang.String abspath)

      • generateKey

        public Generator.Keys generateKey(java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String annotation)
        Generate a key pair.
        Parameters:
        id - The pair will be assigned to the host with this ID.
        annotation - Annotate the key with this string. (This field is used for capability assignement).
        Returns:
        This method returns the generated key pair.

      • createCert

        public Cert createCert(Key signer,
              Key signee)
                throws AuditoriumCryptoException
        Create a certificate (a signed key).
        Parameters:
        signer - This is the key of the signer of the certificate.
        signee - This is the key that will be signed and placed into the certificate.
        Returns:
        This method returns the created certificate.
        Throws:
        AuditoriumCryptoException - This method throws if there are platform issues preventing the signature from happening.
